title: Sampler, 1814
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery, wool warp, linen weft  
Technique: embroidered in satin and stem stitches on plain weave
inscribed: Rebecca Buse finished this work in the ninth year of her age Anno Domini 1814
provenance:
(MJL No. 165);  2002 appraisal #44
Wercus sale Anderson Gallery 1928
dimensions:
Frame H x W: 41.9 x 30.5 cm (16 1/2 x 12 in.)
H x W: 40.3 x 27.9 cm (15 7/8 x 11 in.) unframed
creditline: Gift of Myra and William H. Mathers
description:
In the top half, a verse is surrounded by a flowering vine, with a crown at the top with the initials of King George III. In the lower half, a shepherd piping in the lower left corner and a cottage in the lower right, with a large basket of flowers in the center and the inscription below.
The verse reads: 

Come Children tis Jesus that calls
The voice of your Saviour obey
When Jesus invites you to come
No Disciple shall turn you away

The Children he folds in his arms
Must surely be blessed indeed
For Jesus alone can bestow
The spiritual blessings they need

Let Parents with thankfulness own
The encouragement Jesus has given
Delighted to hear him declare
Of such is the Kingdom of Heaven

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1814.
1814. Medium: silk embroidery, wool warp, linen weft  
Technique: embroidered in satin and stem stitches on plain weave. Gift of Myra and William H. Mathers. 2003-14-12.
